str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: To boast; I glory (exult) proudly. From some base akin to that of aucheo and euchomai; to vaunt.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
From peri; superabundant or superior; by implication, excessive; adverbially violently; neuter preeminence.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Feminine of a compound of oikos and the base of doma; architecture, i.e. a structure; figuratively, confirmation.
Taking down, razing, destroying. From kathaireo; demolition; figuratively, extinction.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To be ashamed, be put to shame. From aischos; to feel shame.
